title_sort: reuben farwell to walt whitman, 5 march 1875
title: Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 5 March 1875
text: March 5th 75Walt WhitmanThe articals[articles] you Sent me I received that is the paper a letter & a Picture and your good wishes all arrived at once.I have not had time to anser[answer] yours untill[until] now. I had an auction yestarday[yesterday] 4 of March to sell my Personally[personal] property As I told you in my other letter I have rented my farm of 35 acers[acres] for 5 yearsI would like to see you very well and it is possiably[possible] We may meet again . if I can get an increase of Pension Probaly[Probably] I will come and see you. Why can not you com[come] & see my family I have a wife & littel[little] Girl 5 years old this month When we received your Picture She kissed it and likes to show it to every one that comes in the houseI felt proud of it myselfI will have to get a frame for it and hang it up on the wallWalt my dear old Friend how I would lik[like] to grasp your hand and give you a kiss as I did in the days of yore. What a satisfaction it would be to me. We give pasesion[possession] the first of April. We move about half a mile from this place my Post office will be the same (address)your in hart[heart] Walt WhitmanRuben[Reuben] FarwellReuben Farwell, March 1875(sent papers & a few lines April 21, '75)I will try and write more next timeGood by[bye] and God bless you Walt WhitmanReuben Farwell Reuben Farwell to Walt Whitman, 5 March 1875
